description: Change of use from A1 (retail shop) to A2 (betting office) and construction of single storey front extension (DUPLICATE APPLICATION)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | Any machinery audible outside the premises must be designed to an acoustic standard not exceeding Noise Rating NR35 measured or calculated at the nearest horizontal or vertical boundary of the nearest affected dwelling, whichever is the closer.   REASON:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers. | Suitable and sufficient acoustic separation to at least that specified in the 1992 Edition of the Approved Document E of the Building Regulations 1991 shall be provided between the commercial premsies and flats above.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of the adjacent occupiers. | The existing shop window shall be retained and used for display purposes and shall not be painted over or otherwise obscured.  REASON:	To maintain the retail character of the shopping area within which the site is situated, and to prevent the fragmentation of the shopping facade. | The use permitted shall not operate outside 9 to 10.30 Monday to Saturday, 10 to 6pm Sundays or Bank Holidays.  REASON:	In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties.
